intro: Reichardia runcinata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows, and it produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seeds. Reichardia runcinata has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and is often found in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
